title: Problem with disappearing internet after opening Firefox - ping
content: We've been having internet disconnection issues for the last few months. After turning on Firefox, the ping starts to "jump" and the internet disappears temporarily. This is happening on two different computers with wifi access. This problem does not occur until Firefox is launched. I tried to use other browsers, even many hours and everything was ok. Edge, Chrome etc. Telephones, TVs in this network do not have these problems. As soon as I open firefox the problem occurs. I've tried almost everything: Standard Firefox procedures: remove the problem, reinstall the program, etc. In turn: changing network cards, disconnecting other devices from the network, changing wifi settings, restarting the modem, contacting the ISP and I did many other things that I can't even do anymore remember... I'm attaching a screenshot of what it looks like. If no one helps me, I will have to change the browser, which I would very much like to avoid.
creator: tommyserafin

title: Firefox can't load some websites, other browsers can
content:
I have a very weird problem with Firefox 114.0.1 x64. I can browser the Web just fine except for some very specific websites. This is the error I get when I try to navigate these websites:

"Unable to connect An error occurred during a connection to ***. The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments. If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer’s network connection. If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Firefox is permitted to access the web."

These websites used to load normally until a couple of days ago, and they load normally on Edge and Chrome and also on Firefox for Android.

I have tried everything listed here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-cant-load-websites-other-browsers-can and here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-and-diagnose-firefox-problems to no avail.

I would post links to these problematic websites but they're about piracy, torrent indexing etc. and I don't know if that's against the rules.
creator: boogiepopfred

title: Restore Previous session and Recently bookmarked not clearing from history
content: I have noticed since my upgrade to the current version of Firefox that there seems to be a glitch or two in regards to when I hit clear all history. This normally would clear the list of recently bookmarked sites. However since upgrading to version 114.0.1, this does not occur as it used to, meaning it's taking up memory, as the recently bookmarked sites from the previous session remain even when I shut down the browser for the night when shutting down my laptop. I have also noticed that the browser will still ask me if I want to restore a previous session even after hitting clear history and shutting down the browser. These were never issues in versions prior to 114 so far as I can tell. Can anyone explain what's happening here and how these can be fixed?
creator: Marc7

title: Cursive Fonts Do Not Display
content:
Hello, I have two websites that I've designed with cursive fonts in some headers. Whereas they display in other browsers, they do not display in Firefox. I asked this question years ago, and to date, no one has provided an answer.

Not only do the headers not display the cursive font: savoye let and allura, what they show are enlarged and bold letters that completely destroy the design. Surely, there is a reason for this.

Here is one of the sites (the other is still in design mode): https://summitlighthousephoenix.org
creator: lindadarlene1

title: Is it possible to retrieve a previous saved version of Firefox?
content:
Unfortunately, I am the victim of a savage Microsoft update that wiped out my hard drive and turned my laptop into a brick. (I’ve spent about five hours over the past several days and $2,500 on a new laptop trying to recover from the damage. Thanks Microsoft.) Turning to Firefox, in trying to put everything on my computer back together again, I didn’t remember my Firefox password, so I had to reset it. When I logged in again, everything was gone: all my favorites and years of bookmarks. Again: everything was gone. The tech support crew that helped me recover from the Microsoft update—well, as much as they could—said this might have had something to do w/ it; that I might have lost the connection w/ Firefox. I don’t know. All I know is that I’ve had years of bookmarks, going back to 2010. And I couldn’t have lost them all in one night just by resetting the password.

Might anyone have any advice on whether I might be able to recover a previous version? Thank you in advance for your help.
creator: tjo787

title: Bookmarks default
content:

Whenever I make a bookmark, it automatically puts it in the Bookmark Toolbar, but I want it to default to the Bookmark Menu. I can't find any way to do that and can't find any good information about it. One site said I needed an ad-on, but I shouldn't need that for something so simple that used to work fine on my old computer with Firefox. I can't find any settings for this at all.

Please help me fix this.

Thank you,

Myrah
